title: Receive Goods Overview page
text: The "Receive Goods" function is used to record the addition of stock quantities into the system. This can be done either by creating new entries during the goods receiving process or by generating quantities based on existing purchase orders. Shop Choose a shop who's Receive Goods you wish to see. The Submit button is not available until a shop has been selected. Vendor You can pick a vendor to narrow down the search or leave the field blank to search all vendors. Status Creating: any Receive Goods that has not been completed. Creating status allows the editing of the Receive Goods. Completed: any Receive Goods that has been completed through the Save and Commit option. Completed Receive Goods cannot be edited. Sets all filters here back to starting values. A Shop must be reselected before the Submit button is available. After the filters have been chosen press Submit to see all Receive Goods that match the filters. To create a new Receive Goods. See the How to Create a New Receive Goods section. Created The date the Receive Goods was originally made. Title The title given when the Receive Goods was created or last edited. Vendor The Vendor associated with this Receive Goods. Total Quantity Shows the total number of items on the Receive Goods. Can be used a quick 'check sum' when comparing the Receive Goods against the delivery note. Total Cost Shows the total Cost of the Receive Goods as Quantity x Cost. Currency The selected currency this Receive Goods will be completed in.
description:
The "Receive Goods" function is used to record the addition of stock quantities into the system. This can be done either by creating new entries during the goods receiving process or by generating quantities based on existing purchase orders.


ShopChoose a shop who's Receive Goods you wish to see. The Submit button is not available until a shop has been selected.
VendorYou can pick a vendor to narrow down the search or leave the field blank to search all vendors.
StatusCreating: any Receive Goods that has not been completed. Creating status allows the editing of the Receive Goods.
Completed: any Receive Goods that has been completed through the Save and Commit option. Completed Receive Goods cannot be edited.


Sets all filters here back to starting values. A Shop must be reselected before the Submit button is available.
After the filters have been chosen press Submit to see all Receive Goods that match the filters.
To create a new Receive Goods. See the How to Create a New Receive Goods section.


Created
The date the Receive Goods was originally made.
Title
The title given when the Receive Goods was created or last edited.
Vendor
The Vendor associated with this Receive Goods.
Total Quantity
Shows the total number of items on the Receive Goods. Can be used a quick 'check sum' when comparing the Receive Goods against the delivery note.
Total Cost
Shows the total Cost of the Receive Goods as Quantity x Cost.
Currency
The selected currency this Receive Goods will be completed in.

title: How to Create a New Receive Goods
text: In order to make a new Receive Goods you will need to nominate a Shop, Vendor and Currency as well as give the Receive Goods a Title. You also have the option to link a Receive Goods to a Purchase Order, create a Receive Goods Number and add some Notes. From the Receive Goods screen use the Create New button You must complete some header information before you can populate the Receive Goods with item. This is so you do not add items you shop does not stock or those the vendor does not supply. Title You must give the Receive Goods a title in line with your business guidelines. This title should be meaningful as you will see it on reports and in other areas of Imagine. Shop Choose a shop where this Receive Goods will apply stock to. The shop will be preselected for you based on the overview page. The Save button is not available until a shop and other mandatory information has been selected. Purchase Order Optionally choose a linked Purchase Order (PO). Items in the PO will be added directly to this Goods receive. You must select a Vendor before any selection are available here. Notes Add any notes you see fit. These only relate to this specific Goods Receive and can only be seen here. Receive Goods Number Either enter your own Receive Goods Number or leave blank and Imagine will generate this for you. Select Vendor Choose a vendor where this Receive Goods will be sent to. The Save button is not available until a vendor and other mandatory information has been selected. Currency Select the currency this Receive Goods will be completed in. Used to mark the Receive Goods as complete, after no more goods will be received against it. You will not be able to edit this Goods receive after it has been Committed. Only available when an item has been added to the Receive Goods and the Save button is available. Used to save progress on this Receive Goods, but without finalising it as Completed. Useful if you are part way through booking in a delivery and need to save your progress. Only available when all mandatory information is completed. Used to return to the overview page, any changes made since your last Save will be lost. Linked Purchase Order To link a Receive Goods to a PO, you can choose from the available placed POs associated with the selected shop and vendor in the "Purchase Order" dropdown. If no POs are displayed, it means there are no POs that match the combination of the selected shop and vendor, or the POs have not been placed yet. Once you select a PO, the items ordered will be displayed in the "Add Item" section, where you can adjust the quantities to reflect the actual received quantities. Manually adding items See Adding Items to a Receive Goods for details how to manually add items to a Receive Goods. Manually adding items is used when you do not have a linked PO, or if the delivered goods do not match those expected on the PO. Cost (total) Shows the total Cost of the Receive Goods as Quantity x Cost Quantity (total) Shows the total number of items on the Receive Goods. Can be used a quick 'check sum' when comparing the Receive Goods against the delivery note. Item table functions Export All Data This will export the data to a .xlxs file for use. Column Chooser Use to select/deselect columns you wish to use. Print Used to print labels, see Printing Labels for further information.
description:
In order to make a new Receive Goods you will need to nominate a Shop, Vendor and Currency as well as give the Receive Goods a Title. You also have the option to link a Receive Goods to a Purchase Order, create a Receive Goods Number and add some Notes.


From the Receive Goods screen use the Create New button


You must complete some header information before you can populate the Receive Goods with item. This is so you do not add items you shop does not stock or those the vendor does not supply.


TitleYou must give the Receive Goods a title in line with your business guidelines. This title should be meaningful as you will see it on reports and in other areas of Imagine.
ShopChoose a shop where this Receive Goods will apply stock to. The shop will be preselected for you based on the overview page. The Save button is not available until a shop and other mandatory information has been selected.
Purchase OrderOptionally choose a linked Purchase Order (PO). Items in the PO will be added directly to this Goods receive. You must select a Vendor before any selection are available here.
NotesAdd any notes you see fit. These only relate to this specific Goods Receive and can only be seen here.


Receive Goods NumberEither enter your own Receive Goods Number or leave blank and Imagine will generate this for you.
Select VendorChoose a vendor where this Receive Goods will be sent to. The Save button is not available until a vendor and other mandatory information has been selected.
CurrencySelect the currency this Receive Goods will be completed in.


Used to mark the Receive Goods as complete, after no more goods will be received against it. You will not be able to edit this Goods receive after it has been Committed. Only available when an item has been added to the Receive Goods and the Save button is available.

Used to save progress on this Receive Goods, but without finalising it as Completed. Useful if you are part way through booking in a delivery and need to save your progress. Only available when all mandatory information is completed.
Used to return to the overview page, any changes made since your last Save will be lost.


Linked Purchase Order
To link a Receive Goods to a PO, you can choose from the available placed POs associated with the selected shop and vendor in the "Purchase Order" dropdown. If no POs are displayed, it means there are no POs that match the combination of the selected shop and vendor, or the POs have not been placed yet. Once you select a PO, the items ordered will be displayed in the "Add Item" section, where you can adjust the quantities to reflect the actual received quantities.


Manually adding items

See Adding Items to a Receive Goods for details how to manually add items to a Receive Goods. Manually adding items is used when you do not have a linked PO, or if the delivered goods do not match those expected on the PO.



Cost (total)Shows the total Cost of the Receive Goods as Quantity x Cost
Quantity (total)Shows the total number of items on the Receive Goods. Can be used a quick 'check sum' when comparing the Receive Goods against the delivery note.


Item table functions

Export All DataThis will export the data to a .xlxs file for use.
Column ChooserUse to select/deselect columns you wish to use.
PrintUsed to print labels, see Printing Labels for further information.

title: How to edit a Creating Receive Goods
text: From the Receive Goods overview page select a Receive Goods to edit it. Only Receive Goods that have a status of Creating can be edited. Receive Goods with a status of Completed can be viewed but not edited, for example the Save and Commit button will not be available to you. You can edit the header information apart from the Receive Goods Number. A shop must be selected before the Save button is available. See the How to Create a New Receive Goods article for details of what is required for the header information. At least one item must be added to the Receive Goods before you are able to Save and Commit. Saving and Committing will mark the Receive Goods status as Complete. To Add items to the Receive Goods see the Adding Items to a Receive Good page. Used to mark the Receive Goods as complete, after no more goods will be received against it. You will not be able to edit this Goods receive after it has been Committed. Only available when an item has been added to the Receive Goods and the Save button is available. Used to save progress on this Receive Goods, but without finalising it as Completed. Useful if you are part way through booking in a delivery and need to save your progress. Only available when all mandatory information is completed. Used to return to the overview page, any changes made since your last Save will be lost. Receive Goods documents can be downloaded as PDF’s. Select the required Receive Goods from the list and click the "Download PDF" this will then begin the PDF generation and you will see a notification "Generating PDF - Please Wait". Depending on which browser you are using your generated PDF will be in your download folder click this to open the PDF. Item table functions Export All Data This will export the data to a .xlxs file for use. Column Chooser Use to select/deselect columns you wish to use. Print Used to print labels, see Printing Labels for further information.
description:
From the Receive Goods overview page select a Receive Goods to edit it. Only Receive Goods that have a status of Creating can be edited. Receive Goods with a status of Completed can be viewed but not edited, for example the Save and Commit button will not be available to you.


You can edit the header information apart from the Receive Goods Number. A shop must be selected before the Save button is available. See the How to Create a New Receive Goods article for details of what is required for the header information.


At least one item must be added to the Receive Goods before you are able to Save and Commit. Saving and Committing will mark the Receive Goods status as Complete.


To Add items to the Receive Goods see the Adding Items to a Receive Good page.


Used to mark the Receive Goods as complete, after no more goods will be received against it. You will not be able to edit this Goods receive after it has been Committed. Only available when an item has been added to the Receive Goods and the Save button is available.
Used to save progress on this Receive Goods, but without finalising it as Completed. Useful if you are part way through booking in a delivery and need to save your progress. Only available when all mandatory information is completed.
Used to return to the overview page, any changes made since your last Save will be lost.

Receive Goods documents can be downloaded as PDF’s. Select the required Receive Goods from the list and click the "Download PDF" this will then begin the PDF generation and you will see a notification "Generating PDF - Please Wait".  

Depending on which browser you are using your generated PDF will be in your download folder click this to open the PDF.


Item table functions

Export All DataThis will export the data to a .xlxs file for use.
Column ChooserUse to select/deselect columns you wish to use.
PrintUsed to print labels, see Printing Labels for further information.

title: Adding Items to a Receive Goods
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Manually Via a Purchase Order There are two ways in which items can be populated on to a Receive Goods, manually or via Purchase Order. Manually: you add each item as needed to the Receive Goods via barcodes or lookups. Via a Purchase Order: you are able to pick a Purchase Order to link to your Receive Goods. When you do this the list of items on a Receive Goods will taken from the linked Purchase Order. Manually To Add items manually to a Goods Receive you must not have selected to receive from a purchase order, that is, on the Receive Goods the Purchase Order field is not populated with a Purchase Order Number. Add by barcode: Ensure the Add by barcode field is selected and then scan a product barcode. On recognising a know barcode this filed will add the item to the grid. If the item already exists, the quantity will be incremented by 1 for each scan. If the barcode is not linked to an item then you will be prompted that no item was found. This field will only recognise barcodes as listed in the Barcodes field on the item matrix tab. You can type the barcode rather than scanning it if you do not have a barcode scanner available. Lookup button: Use the "Lookup" button to display the Add Items window. From this screen, you can search for items based on any item's properties. By entering a quantity or using the +/- buttons to increment the quantity, you can populate the grid. Once you have set the quantities for all items, select "Add Items" to include them in the Receive Goods. Via a Purchase Order To populate a receive goods from an existing purchase order, follow these steps: Select a vendor: Choose the desired vendor from the available options. Choose the Purchase Order drop-down: Click on the Purchase Order drop-down menu to view the list of available placed purchase orders. Select a purchase order: Once you have chosen a purchase order, the item grid will automatically be populated with the items to receive, and the quantity will be pre-set based on the purchase order. Note: over-receiving quantities on a purchase order are only allowed when the "Allow over-receive of PO" setting is enabled in the Shops Details section of Back Office. If this option is not enabled, over-receiving is not possible. Note: it is not possible to add additional items within the Goods Receipt Note when it is linked to a purchase order. In such cases, a new goods receipt or purchase order must be created to receive items that are not already listed in the original purchase order. Note: once a purchase order is placed, it cannot be altered, except where the "Allow Placed purchase orders to be changed" option is enabled in Portal Configuration. This allows the Quantity and Cost values only to be altered.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Manually
  • Via a Purchase Order

There are two ways in which items can be populated on to a Receive Goods, manually or via Purchase Order.


Manually: you add each item as needed to the Receive Goods via barcodes or lookups.

Via a Purchase Order: you are able to pick a Purchase Order to link to your Receive Goods. When you do this the list of items on a Receive Goods will taken from the linked Purchase Order.


Manually

To Add items manually to a Goods Receive you must not have selected to receive from a purchase order, that is, on the Receive Goods the Purchase Order field is not populated with a Purchase Order Number.


Add by barcode: Ensure the Add by barcode field is selected and then scan a product barcode. On recognising a know barcode this filed will add the item to the grid. If the item already exists, the quantity will be incremented by 1 for each scan. If the barcode is not linked to an item then you will be prompted that no item was found. This field will only recognise barcodes as listed in the Barcodes field on the item matrix tab. You can type the barcode rather than scanning it if you do not have a barcode scanner available.


Lookup button: Use the "Lookup" button to display the Add Items window. From this screen, you can search for items based on any item's properties. By entering a quantity or using the +/- buttons to increment the quantity, you can populate the grid. Once you have set the quantities for all items, select "Add Items" to include them in the Receive Goods.



Via a Purchase Order

To populate a receive goods from an existing purchase order, follow these steps:


  • Select a vendor: Choose the desired vendor from the available options.
  • Choose the Purchase Order drop-down: Click on the Purchase Order drop-down menu to view the list of available placed purchase orders.
  • Select a purchase order: Once you have chosen a purchase order, the item grid will automatically be populated with the items to receive, and the quantity will be pre-set based on the purchase order.
  • Note: over-receiving quantities on a purchase order are only allowed when the "Allow over-receive of PO" setting is enabled in the Shops Details section of Back Office. If this option is not enabled, over-receiving is not possible.
  • Note: it is not possible to add additional items within the Goods Receipt Note when it is linked to a purchase order. In such cases, a new goods receipt or purchase order must be created to receive items that are not already listed in the original purchase order.
  • Note: once a purchase order is placed, it cannot be altered, except where the "Allow Placed purchase orders to be changed" option is enabled in Portal Configuration. This allows the Quantity and Cost values only to be altered.

title: Printing Labels
text: Clicking the print option, a pop-up window will appear as shown below. To proceed with printing, you need to complete the following steps: Select and set a label template for all items: Before printing, a label template must be chosen and set for each item. This can be done individually for each item or by selecting a template from the top drop-down menu and choosing "Set All" to apply it to all items. Select a connector for printing: Choose a connector that connects to the desired printing device. This allows the system to communicate with the printer and send the print commands appropriately. In the lower grid section of the pop-up, you have the option to save the selected template as the default template for the master item. By choosing "Save the template to master item," you can overwrite the current default template set for the master item. Once you have completed these steps, you can initiate the printing process by pressing the "Print" button.
description:
Clicking the print option, a pop-up window will appear as shown below. To proceed with printing, you need to complete the following steps:


  • Select and set a label template for all items: Before printing, a label template must be chosen and set for each item. This can be done individually for each item or by selecting a template from the top drop-down menu and choosing "Set All" to apply it to all items.


  • Select a connector for printing: Choose a connector that connects to the desired printing device. This allows the system to communicate with the printer and send the print commands appropriately.


  • In the lower grid section of the pop-up, you have the option to save the selected template as the default template for the master item. By choosing "Save the template to master item," you can overwrite the current default template set for the master item.


Once you have completed these steps, you can initiate the printing process by pressing the "Print" button.
